content.raw:
I tried merging in your branch but `PhysicsTorsionalFrictionTest.CoefficientTest` fails. Also, the example world behaves differently, there seems to be less friction... The errors are like this:

~~~
[ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/PhysicsTorsionalFrictionTest.CoefficientTest/0
[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.1.52
[Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:169] ServerFixture load in 2.1 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
[Dbg] [physics_torsional_friction.cc:331] Model sphere_coefficient_1
[Dbg] [physics_torsional_friction.cc:331] Model sphere_coefficient_2
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/test/integration/physics_torsional_friction.cc:332: Failure
The difference between sphere.error.Map()["maxAbs"] and 0.0 is 2.8602901839149126, which exceeds g_friction_tolerance, where
sphere.error.Map()["maxAbs"] evaluates to 2.8602901839149126,
0.0 evaluates to 0, and
g_friction_tolerance evaluates to 0.001.
[Dbg] [physics_torsional_friction.cc:331] Model sphere_coefficient_3
/home/louisep/gazebo_source/gazebo/test/integration/physics_torsional_friction.cc:332: Failure
The difference between sphere.error.Map()["maxAbs"] and 0.0 is 14.301450919563649, which exceeds g_friction_tolerance, where
sphere.error.Map()["maxAbs"] evaluates to 14.301450919563649,
0.0 evaluates to 0, and
g_friction_tolerance evaluates to 0.001.
...
~~~
content.html:
I tried merging in your branch but PhysicsTorsionalFrictionTest.CoefficientTest fails. Also, the example world behaves differently, there seems to be less friction... The errors are like this:
